title: Nice place! Location.Can have a pan-India collection of plants being grown at all elevations!
review: There is scope in the 'jarri-booti' section,to have a collection of plants that grow in all climates

title: Relatively small place with limited things to see
review: The Himalayan Botanical garden is quite a small place and has no big trees. It has some small flower plants and a Butterfly museum. The day we went they also had a photography exhibition by lady photographers which contained some really good photos.

title: the govt means well
review: the place requires more work and much better exhibit of flowers and general descriptions. they have tried to put in too much in a congested space. they can take a lesson from a similar govt garden in munnar kerela

title: Good experience.
review: Everything from Botanical you can find here. one of the best experience when you are in Nainital do visit not too far from the city.

title: Ok Ok.
review: Nice varieties of species but not as good as expected too much to walk and you can get various species and botanical info.

title: Nicely maintained garden
review: A small botanical garden on the way to nainital which houses local species of trees, plants and flowers. A good place to know the flora of the region

title: You can see some rare herbal plants
review: A well maintained and a must visit place for tourists interested in herbal plants. You can buy some saplings to take back home.

title: Worth skipping.
review: Not much to view there considering the distance it takes from town to get there.

title: Wonderful Place
review: A very well maintained botanical garden with great feel to the place. Has interesting view points and trails to explore. Display regarding butterflies and insects is very interesting. The in-house canteen is also very good

title: This place is a botany lover place
review: This place is just half km from Uttaranchal Restaurant. Tourist specially with botany knowledge can view and learn here about herbs and herbs.

title: Beautiful
review: An important center for the study of botany is also famous for herbarium and Butterfly Park.

title: its four KM from The Mall Road on way to Nainital - Kalagundi Road
review: Forest Deptt is maintaining and they have planted some trees - it will become a beautiful garden in coming years. quite place to visit. couples/ families must visit with children. they will get good knowledge about plant - its Botanical Garden

title: A good garden
review: A good place for plant lovers.  An average place to visit. There are not much flowers.  I think it is a good place to visit in starting of winter.

title: Must for Plant lover
review: A Garden atop of hills.( 1901 Mtr)

title: Beautiful experience & initiative by Forest department
review: It has various species of flowers, plants. It also show case wide variety of insects, butterfly, moths who live in the lap of nature. They also have various small-small gardens where various varieties of plants-flowers are cultivated.

title: Bad time to Visit
review: We have visited this place in December this year.The main attraction like butterfly we do not seen and also flower seen in less varieties but scenic beauty of this place is good and enjoyable.

title: You can watch if you have extra time
review: There are not many flowers as compared to other Botanical gardens. But nice place if you have extra time to spend it

title: For Nature Lovers
review: If you love mother nature you must be there, good place to botanist, variety of plants, really good place

title: What a lovely place.
review: It was only 50 rupees to get in. The coffee although small was the best we had tasted in India. The displays of butterflies were very interesting. Well worth a visit.

title: Ok type garden.
review: Not so good. its an average kind of garden in the hill area with some plants and flowers.But it is very well maintained.

title: Small Garden with lots of Flower plants but Hidden Gem is Butterfly Museum
review: This is small garden with lots of flower plants. but best part of this garden is Butterfly museum. They kept lots of Himalayan Butterfly (Taxidermy). Amazing collection and can gain lot of knowledge about butterfly. Can you believe there is poisoned butterfly too. I know this from visiting this place.

title: one time visit
review: one can visit this garden during trip to nainital. good place for plant lovers. average place to visit. one can click photos on diff points of garden.

title: Avoid it to save your time and energy
review: It's nothing sort of a garden..no flowers, even at some places there are only boards but no plant. Not a single person was there but us, you just roam on your own find nothing and come back frustrated. No butterflies as mentioned in some reviews no sceinic views. Just a waste of time.

title: Desert Garden
review: If you are nature lover, you will love this place.

title: Only for botany and flower photography
review: I visited this place solo only for flower photography. At this time of year I could see few colorful flowers , but there was no guide around to explain anything. This could be a much better maintained place.

title: Nothing but a Garden
review: Not so charming. Few flower here and there. It is located at near Sariyatal towards kaladungi roughly 5 km from nainital. You can visit if you are going towards kaladungi or pangot.

title: Nice Garden! Scenic beauty
review: It is a nice place. You can click good picture over there. very well maintained. My family had a great time there. Ausum weather added to our joy. Would love to go there again

title: Quiet place from busy Nainital city
review: Enjoy the best of plants and flowers in Nainital Botanical Garden. It is situated between high mountains with spectacular view of the hills

title: Lovely place for botanical students and people
review: This place is amazing with lots of herbs and plants. Its good place to visit in starting of winter. You can see many flowers and plants. I have shared picture here. Check out.

title: Could have been much better!
review: In this month, we could hardly find any flowers or popular vegetation. The management doesn't seem to be doing much on its maintenance or increase tourism at this place, which has potential for great development. Most of the vegetation seemed wild.

title: Connect with nature
review: If you love nature and botany, then you must visit these gardens. There are a variety of Himalayan flora displayed.

title: not yet infrastructured
review: botanical garden is there but nothing is to be spent there might be they are making garden not very interesting........

title: Needs improvement in maintenance and infrastructure
review: Though I was not very impressed with the facilities but after seeing Plants and Local herbs, i felt you can visit the place once. Just one shop for buying T-shirts and other stuff.

title: Beautyful garden
review: this is very beautiful botanical garden but i not vive properly but i reach the garden closing time i see the garden flower and more

title: Excellent Place to check out
review: It's a great place to see and taste a few rare plants. We had a wonderful guide who took us through the place and made us taste a few interesting leaves. It was a unique experience :)

title: An Educational trip
review: An amazing experience!!!!!

title: Educational trip
review: Kids can learn many items there . Butterfly development was clearly explained by staff over there. T shirts were sold near the gate. It was nice .

title: Nice Botanical Garden visited in Oct 15
review: I decided to include this place in my list after getting info from my travel agent.This is new Botanical garden & need at least 1 Hr to visit it completely.You can spend your leisure time here in peacful way.Very fantastic view of Nainital & some really good pics can be captured from here.

title: Just OK OK Experienct
review: If you have spare time with you when you are in Nainital then you can visit...Entry ticket is 20 Rs. Just 5 Km from Nainital...

title: Good for Persons having medicinal interest
review: various shrubs & flowers of medicinal value are displayed here. can see them & know their value. rest nothing is here so attracting

title: Nice garden
review: The garden was ok but for me it was just a walk down the garden and nothing more than that . later all looks the same to me

title: Lots of natural beauty
review: This place has lots of big trees, plants and flower plants. This is really amazing place. I spend half day over here and enjoyed natural beauty in the lap of mountain.

title: Okay to visit. Good for Botany Students.
review: It is just a gardern there are different plants with their botanical name. It is okay to visit for those who are not interested but if you have time then do visit.

title: Average botanical garden!!!
review: The Himlayan Botanical Garden is a centre of study for the scientists and the botanists.It is located at Sariyatal near Nainital.The major attractions include an orchidarium, fernatum, herbarium, Thunia alba orchid, geodesic dome, waterfalls, etc. It is a very good Eco Tourism Destination. This is just a garden, so visit it if you are really interested,else you can give it a pass.

title: Lot of herbs and medicinal plants
review: Wonderful to see lot of herbs and plants not heitherto known to me. It takes almost 25 minutes to visit here.

title: Interest for Botany Lovers
review: Few Kilometers away from Nainital is much interesting for Botany students, i have not enjoyed very much on the top of the hills, there are many plants and vegetable has been kept for viewing but nice to see some cacter plants and alovera plants which is used in cosmetics, basically for research students who are studying in botany.There some more variety of flowers can be seen which are rare species.

title: Average place
review: Himalayan Botanical Garden is a picturesque and splendid garden and is exquisite in its natural beauty. The backdrop of the snow covered peaks provides a mesmerizing view. Himalayan Botanical Garden is a must visit on a trip to Nainital. The garden also has a collection of many endangered plant species.

title: enroute to nainital
review: can be seen from road, one can take pictures. its a large area with govt focusing on native species of plant

title: A collection of several native plant species
review: The Himlayan Botanical Garden is a centre of study for the scientists and the botanists. Himalayan Botanic Gardens is located at Sariatal, 5km from Nainital on Nanital Kaladhungi road, the lake city of Uttarakhand in the Himalayas. This garden, extending to an area of 30 hectares has a collection of several native plant species, many of which are rare and endangered. The major attractions include an orchidarium, fernatum, herbarium, Thunia alba orchid, geodesic dome, waterfalls, etc. The entry ticket is Rs. 20. The botanic garden is run by the Uttarakhand Forest Department. It is a very good Eco Tourism Destination. This is a unique project in Uttarakhand which has used reclaimed and degraded land for providing awareness on Himalayan environment.

title: Good views
review: We recently visited this place about 10 km from nainital.The views from this place is amazing and a must visit on a trip to nainital

title: Hills garden
review: Not maintained as a picnic spot. If you are plant lover than can take shot visit. some unique plants are available.

title: What a shame !!! A big NO
review: A big No to anybody planning to visit thinking it to be a garden or something relating to botany or garden. A govt. Undertaking charging ticket of 20/- per person 10 km away from city is mere waste of time energy and money .

title: Plan well to include this in your itinerary
review: Good but not the best. You plan your itinerary such a way that you can spend 1 hr to give rest to yourself. Different varities of plants you'll get over here.
